alert.note: Alert for Western Greenbrier (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 31 at 2:33PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Greenbrier County through 245 PM EDT... At 233 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Richwood, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of north central Greenbrier County. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Locally heavy rain will quickly reduce visibility and result in ponding of water on roadways, standing water in low lying areas, and minor flooding of creeks, streams, and areas of poor drainage. Drivers are urged to slow down and use extra caution to avoid hydroplaning.
